example.text: Standing with Ukraine: One Year Later As you may know, the first anniversary of Putin's invasion of Ukraine recently passed. This act of aggression was not only illegal but a reckless breach of global peace.

That's why I recently supported the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (NDAA), which I am proud to say passed the House of Representatives with strong support from Democrats and Republicans. The NDAA includes wins for the regional economy, Washington state's environment, and our region's talented civilian workforce, who are doing vitally important work to keep our country safe.
We also discussed the work left for Congress before the year ends. I'm grateful for the AWB's work to create and maintain good jobs in our region!

Last week, I met Norm at the [[user]] Jobs Program – providing tiny homes and city jobs to folks experiencing chronic homelessness. Thanks for helping to address homelessness and workforce development in our neck of the woods! [[url]]

Working for You Preserving Local Maritime Industries Great checking in with the leadership at SAFE Boats, a leading supplier of watercraft to the military and federal, state, and local law enforcement. Recently, the Navy awarded SAFE Boats a contract to build Mark VI patrol boats for Ukraine - thanks for doing business in Tacoma!

Excited to celebrate the passage of the Water Resources Development Act (WRDA) last week, and to see the important water resources, flood control, and ecosystem restoration work they do continue in our region. Creating Jobs at Home I recently got the chance to talk to the Association of Washington Business (AWB) about recent progress made on infrastructure, semiconductor manufacturing, and efforts to combat inflation and climate change.
